newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Sun Int'l in joint venture with black group.
newsitem.headline: Sun Int'l in joint venture with black group.

text.p: Sun International South Africa Ltd has joined forces with a Western Cape black empowerment group to form a new leisure industry investment company, SunWest International.

In a statement on Thursday, Sun International managing director Peter Bacon said that 51 percent of the new company would be owned by black investors Grand Parade Investments and AfriSun with Sun International holding the balance.
As part of the deal, the new company would own the new international five star hotel, The Table Bay, on the Victoria & Albert Waterfront.
SunWest hoped to make other investments in the Cape's leisure industry, including a bid for the lucrative Western Cape Metropolitan Casino.
SunWest International chairman Peter Swartz said that this was the first time black investors in the Western Cape would have a stake in a major development at the waterfront.

Of the 49 percent held by Sun International in SunWest, leisure group Kersaf holds an effective 16 percent and Southern Sun has four percent. The remaining 29 percent is split between development corporations of the former homelands and ordinary shareholders.
The development corporations would have to sell their shares by May 1999 and these would also be sold to black groups, the statement said.
